DOC.brief_summary: Educational research study where goal is to test educational materials that help people make informed decisions about lung cancer screening.
DOC.brief_title: PCORI-CER-1306-03385 Informed Decisions About Lung Cancer Screening
DOC.detailed_description: This is second phase of a larger project funded by the Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Institute to help heavy smokers make informed decisions about lung cancer screening with low-dose computed tomography (LDCT). The aim of this phase is to compare outcomes for promoting informed screening decisions about lung cancer screening in a randomized trial of patients who smoke recruited through state-based smoking cessation quitlines, where patients will be randomly assigned to the updated patient decision aid or to standard educational materials on lung cancer screening.
DOC.criteria: 1. Men and women 55 to 77 years of age. 2. Participants must speak English. 3. Current smoker or quit smoking within the past 15 years. 4. At least a 30 packyear smoking history. 1) History of lung cancer.
